windows_terminal.notes: CSI 1/2 t handled via WindowManipulationType::IconifyWindow and DeIconifyWindow in adaptDispatch.cpp:3442-3446

tmux.notes: Sequence parsed but ignored (case 1/2 in winops)

bobcat.notes: Handled via WhenWindowMinimize callback; requires WindowActions enabled in profile

st.notes: No CSI t window manipulation sequences implemented

__compat.title: Move window
__compat.description: CSI 3;x;y t — Move to pixel position

windows_terminal.notes: CSI 3;x;y t not in WindowManipulationType enum (DispatchTypes.hpp:584-594)

tmux.notes: Sequence parsed but ignored (case 3 in winops)

bobcat.notes: Handled via WhenWindowGeometryChange callback; requires WindowActions enabled in profile

st.notes: No CSI t window manipulation sequences implemented

__compat.title: Resize (pixels)
__compat.description: CSI 4;h;w t — Resize window to pixels

wezterm.notes: Parsed but not allowed for security

vte.notes: Converts pixels to cells and emits resize-window signal

windows_terminal.notes: CSI 4;h;w t not in WindowManipulationType enum

tmux.notes: Sequence parsed but ignored (case 4 in winops)

bobcat.notes: Handled via WhenWindowGeometryChange callback; requires WindowActions enabled in profile

putty.notes: CSI 4 t recognized but not implemented (terminal.c:4877-4882: 'resizing code isn't healthy enough')

st.notes: No CSI t window manipulation sequences implemented

vte.notes: Parsed but implementation is stub - breaks without action

windows_terminal.notes: CSI 5/6 t not in WindowManipulationType enum

tmux.notes: Sequence parsed but ignored (case 5/6 in winops)

bobcat.notes: Handled via WhenWindowGeometryChange callback; requires WindowActions enabled in profile

st.notes: No CSI t window manipulation sequences implemented

__compat.title: Resize (chars)
__compat.description: CSI 8;rows;cols t — Resize text area to characters

wezterm.notes: Parsed but not allowed for security

tmux.notes: Sequence parsed but ignored (case 8 in winops)

bobcat.notes: Handled via WhenSetSize callback; requires WindowActions enabled in profile

st.notes: No CSI t window manipulation sequences implemented

vte.notes: Parsed with parameters but implementation is stub - breaks without action

windows_terminal.notes: CSI 9;Ps t not in WindowManipulationType enum

konsole.notes: CSI 9 t not implemented; UI has maximize but no escape sequence

tmux.notes: Sequence parsed but ignored (case 9 in winops)

bobcat.notes: Handled via WhenWindowMaximize callback; requires WindowActions enabled in profile

st.notes: No CSI t window manipulation sequences implemented

vte.notes: Parsed but implementation is stub - breaks without action

windows_terminal.notes: CSI 10;Ps t not in WindowManipulationType enum

tmux.notes: Sequence parsed but ignored (case 10 in winops)

bobcat.notes: Handled via WhenWindowFullScreen callback; requires WindowActions enabled in profile

putty.notes: CSI 10 t not implemented; switch statement has cases 1-9, 11, 13-14, 18, 20-21 only

mlterm.notes: CSI 10 t explicitly not supported (comment in code)

st.notes: No CSI t window manipulation sequences implemented

foot.notes: CSI 11 t always reports not-iconified - doesn't know actual state

vte.notes: Reports iconified state from internal flag

windows_terminal.notes: CSI 11 t not in WindowManipulationType enum

tmux.notes: Sequence parsed but ignored (case 11 in winops)

screen.notes: CSI 11 t reports iconified/not at src/ansi.c:976

st.notes: No CSI t window manipulation sequences implemented

foot.notes: CSI 13 t always reports (0,0) - doesn't know actual position

windows_terminal.notes: CSI 13 t not in WindowManipulationType enum

tmux.notes: Sequence parsed but ignored (case 13 in winops)

st.notes: No CSI t window manipulation sequences implemented

__compat.title: Text area (pixels)
__compat.description: CSI 14 t — Text area size in pixels

ghostty.notes: CSI 14 t reports text area size in pixels

wezterm.notes: Reports text area size in pixels

foot.notes: CSI 14 t reports text area/window size in pixels

vte.notes: Reports calculated text area size in pixels

windows_terminal.notes: CSI 14 t via WindowManipulationType::ReportTextSizeInPixels in adaptDispatch.cpp:3457. Reports virtual pixel size for Sixel

tmux.notes: Reports text area in pixels (CSI 14 t)

contour.notes: CSI 14 t and CSI 14;2 t implemented (cases 14, 16, 18, 19)

screen.notes: CSI 14 t not implemented; CSI 18 t reports chars not pixels

st.notes: No CSI t window manipulation sequences implemented

zellij.notes: CSI 14 t and CSI 16 t (character cell size report)

tuios.notes: CSI 14 t, 16 t, and 18 t supported

__compat.title: Cell size
__compat.description: CSI 16 t — Cell size in pixels

xterm.notes: Requires OPT_MAXIMIZE compile flag (enabled by default)

kitty.notes: Reports cell size in pixels via CSI 6;height;width t

foot.notes: Implemented at csi.c:1347-1354, reports cell height and width in pixels

alacritty.notes: Explicitly rejected - CSI 16 t not in supported list (escape_support.md line 81-82)

iterm2.notes: Not implemented. Parser explicitly marks Ps=16 as VT100_NOTSUPPORT. Delegate method terminalCellSizeInPoints exists but is not connected to this sequence.

vte.notes: CSI 16 t not implemented; VTE skips from operation 14 to 18 in XTERM_WM enum

windows_terminal.notes: Implemented as ReportCharacterCellSize in WindowManipulationType enum (value 16)

konsole.notes: Reports cell size in pixels via CSI 6 t response

mintty.notes: Reports cell dimensions via CSI 16 t, implemented in src/termout.c:3045

cy.notes: CSI t (XTWINOPS) explicitly ignored since v0.1.0

tmux.notes: Reports cell size in pixels via w->xpixel and w->ypixel

putty.notes: Not implemented; CSI t handler only includes cases 1-21 (excluding 10,12,15,16,17)

screen.notes: CSI 16 t not implemented; only CSI 7/8/11/18/21 t are handled

rxvt_unicode.notes: Not implemented; fwidth/fheight available internally but no CSI 16 t handler

__compat.title: Text area (chars)
__compat.description: CSI 18 t — Text area size in characters

kitty.notes: Reports text area size in characters via CSI 8;height;width t

foot.notes: Implemented at csi.c:1356-1362, reports terminal rows and columns

alacritty.notes: Implemented via text_area_size_chars() at term/mod.rs:2268, responds with CSI 8 t

windows_terminal.notes: Implemented as ReportTextSizeInCharacters in WindowManipulationType enum (value 18)

konsole.notes: Reports terminal size in characters via CSI 8 t response

mintty.notes: Reports terminal size in characters via CSI 18 t, implemented in src/termout.c:3046

cy.notes: CSI t (XTWINOPS) explicitly ignored since v0.1.0

putty.notes: Implemented at terminal.c:4940-4946, reports text area size in characters via CSI 8;rows;cols t

screen.notes: Reports window size in characters via CSI 18 t

__compat.title: Title stack
__compat.description: CSI 22/23 t — Push/pop window title stack

xterm.notes: Requires OPT_TITLE_MODES compile flag (enabled by default)

ghostty.notes: Only supports window title (params[1] = 0 or 2), not icon title

kitty.notes: Push/pop window title stack with maxlen=10

wezterm.notes: Parser recognizes sequences but handler is empty (no-op) at term/src/terminalstate/mod.rs:2090-2095

foot.notes: Implemented at csi.c:1392-1413, only handles title (param 0 or 2), ignores icon label (param 1)

alacritty.notes: Implemented via push_title()/pop_title() at term/mod.rs:2235,2249. Max stack depth: 4096 (TITLE_STACK_MAX_DEPTH)

iterm2.notes: Both push (CSI 22 t) and pop (CSI 23 t) implemented with parameter support: 0=both, 1=icon, 2=window. See VT100Terminal.m:2793-2819

vte.notes: Only supports window title (CSI 22;0 t / CSI 22;2 t); icon title stack (CSI 22;1 t) not implemented. Max stack depth: 8

windows_terminal.notes: Not present in WindowManipulationType enum; only values 1,2,7,8,14,16,18 are supported

konsole.notes: Explicitly ignored with comment in code (src/Vt102Emulation.cpp:2014-2015)

mintty.notes: Full push/pop stack for window titles via CSI 22/23 t, implemented in src/termout.c:3059-3064 with stack management in src/winmain.c:1439-1464

xterm_js.notes: Requires windowOptions.pushTitle and windowOptions.popTitle to be enabled

cy.notes: CSI t (XTWINOPS) explicitly ignored since v0.1.0

tmux.notes: Supports both CSI 22 t (push) and CSI 23 t (pop)

putty.notes: Not implemented; no case 22 or 23 handlers in window manipulation code

mlterm.notes: When icon and window titles are pushed together (ps[1]=0), popping either one doesn't pop the other as xterm does. See XtermWinopsTests in esctest.

screen.notes: CSI 22/23 t not implemented; no title stack functionality

rxvt_unicode.notes: Not implemented; no CSI 22/23 t handlers for push/pop title stack

tuios.notes: Only CSI 14/16/18 t are implemented in XTWINOPS handler
